definition: (archaic) light, bright (variant of 冏[jiong3])/(since c. 2005) (slang) emoticon signifying embarrassment, shock, helplessness etc
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 13), occurring in 用, 同, 网 etc/see also 同字框[tong2 zi4 kuang4]

sentences.english: Joe Johnson has agreed to terms with the Hawks on a maximum-salary contract.
sentences.chinese: 囧囧森接受了小鳥開出的頂薪合同。

sentences.english: Joe Johnson has agreed to terms with the Hawks on a maximum-salary contract.
sentences.chinese: 囧囧森接受了小鳥開出的頂薪合同。

sentences.english: S. companies, plus 100 in Canada recalled the most embarrassing or bizarre interview moments they had witnessed or heard of.
sentences.chinese: 一起來看看讓人最囧或讓人噴飯的面試時刻。

sentences.english: The embarrassing thing denotes that it is awkward or helpless.
sentences.chinese: “囧事”的網義是指尷尬，無奈的事情。

sentences.english: This email is sending from Johnnys International.
sentences.chinese: 這封郵件來自與國際囧尼斯。

sentences.english: You know the United States historys most fcucking 30 law?
sentences.chinese: 你們知道美國曆史上最囧的30條法律嗎？

sentences.english: Don't panic if you do something embarrassing. A lot of girls find that really cute.
sentences.chinese: 不小心做了囧事，別緊張，女生們會認爲這很可愛。

sentences.english: “It was very embarrassing, ” Yao told the Xinhua News Agency.
sentences.chinese: “那實在是太囧了”姚明告訴新華社的記者。

sentences.english: She is. And so it’s embarrassing sometimes.

definition: velvetleaf (Abutilon avicennae), plant of the jute family/bright
cup/(slang) (pun on 悲劇|悲剧[bei1 ju4], tragedy) so bad/terrible/bummer/fiasco/debacle
dry rations (for a journey)/(dialect) (of noodles etc) to become mush (from overcooking)/(coll.) embarrassing/embarrassment
phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
dark reddish purple/Internet slang abbr. for 這樣子|这样子[zhe4 yang4 zi5]
to work as a carter or porter/to transport goods for a living (esp. by donkey)
mythical horse/Internet slang for 什麼|什么[shen2 me5]
